page.title: 01Summary of the area
page.content: The area is predominantly farmland although there is also a good amount of deciduous woodland,and four villages which fall wholly or in part within the block .These are _ {(1) Meden Vale},a"pit village" of N.C.B.terraced and semi-detached homes which was once simply called "Welbeck Colliery Village." Adjoining the village is "Welbeck Colliery",a productive pit in the North Nottinghamshire Area of the N.C.B.. {(2) Church Warsop, }an interesting mixture of old properties ,and more modern N.C.B.and private houses. {(3)Cuckney}and{(4)Norton}are to the north-west of the block and consist of mainly old,stone-built detached and terraced homes rented from the{ {"Welbeck Estates Co."}_the Estate of the Dukes of Portland _ which is the major land owner in the area.
